clauses.title: Organizational roles, responsibilities and authorities
clauses.description: Top management shall ensure that the responsibilities and authorities for relevant roles are assigned, communicated and understood within the organization.

clauses.title: Actions to address risks and opportunities
clauses.description: When planning for the EOMS, the organization shall consider the issues referred to in 4.1 and the requirements referred to in 4.2 and determine the risks and opportunities that need to be addressed.

clauses.title: Objectives of the EOMS and planning to achieve them
clauses.description: The organization shall establish objectives for the EOMS at relevant functions and levels. The objectives shall be consistent with the EOMS policy, be measurable, take into account applicable requirements, and be relevant to conformity of products and services and enhancement of satisfaction.

clauses.title: Resources
clauses.description: The organization shall determine and provide the resources needed for the establishment, implementation, maintenance and continual improvement of the EOMS.

clauses.title: Competence
clauses.description: The organization shall determine the necessary competence of person(s) doing work under its control that affects its EOMS performance and take actions to acquire necessary competence.

clauses.title: Awareness
clauses.description: Persons doing work under the organization’s control shall be aware of the EOMS policy, relevant EOMS objectives, their contribution to the effectiveness of the EOMS, and the implications of not conforming with the EOMS requirements.

clauses.title: Communication
clauses.description: The organization shall determine the internal and external communications relevant to the EOMS including: on what it will communicate; when to communicate; with whom to communicate; and how to communicate.

clauses.title: Documented information
clauses.description: The organization’s EOMS shall include documented information required by this document and documented information determined by the organization as being necessary for the effectiveness of the EOMS.

clauses.title: Operational planning and control
clauses.description: The organization shall plan, implement and control the processes needed to meet requirements for the provision of educational products and services.

clauses.title: Requirements for educational products and services
clauses.description: The organization shall establish, implement and maintain a process to communicate with interested parties in relation to information on educational products and services, handling enquiries, contracts or orders, and obtaining their views, perceptions, complaints and feedback.

clauses.title: Design and development of educational products and services
clauses.description: The organization shall establish, implement and maintain a design and development process that is appropriate to ensure the subsequent provision of educational products and services.

clauses.title: Control of externally provided processes, products and services
clauses.description: The organization shall ensure that externally provided processes, products and services conform to requirements.

clauses.title: Provision of educational products and services
clauses.description: The organization shall implement the provision of educational products and services under controlled conditions.

clauses.title: Release of educational products and services
clauses.description: The organization shall implement planned arrangements at appropriate stages to verify that the educational product and service requirements have been met.

clauses.title: Control of nonconforming educational outputs
clauses.description: The organization shall ensure that outputs that do not conform to their requirements are identified and controlled to prevent their unintended use or delivery.

clauses.title: Monitoring, measurement, analysis and evaluation
clauses.description: The organization shall determine what needs to be monitored and measured, the methods for monitoring, measurement, analysis and evaluation, when they shall be performed, and when the results shall be analysed and evaluated.

clauses.title: Nonconformity and corrective action
clauses.description: When a nonconformity occurs, the organization shall react to the nonconformity and, as applicable take action to control and correct it and deal with the consequences.

clauses.title: Continual improvement
clauses.description: The organization shall continually improve the suitability, adequacy and effectiveness of the EOMS.

clauses.title: Opportunities for improvement
clauses.description: The organization shall actively seek and identify opportunities for improvement of its EOMS.
